news_header: Nordnet experienced a data breach affecting 1,500 customers in the Nordic countries, with 500 in Denmark and Finland, 350 in Norway, and 200 in Sweden. Customers could see and even sell others' investment information.
news_original_title: Nordnetin 1 500 asiakkaan tiedot näkyivät muille – suomalaisia joukossa 500
news_text: One incident involved a Swedish customer mistakenly selling shares from a Finnish account. Nordnet has contacted all affected customers and is working with authorities to address the situation. The company may face significant penalties for data protection violations, potentially up to EUR 20 million. They have taken swift action to mitigate the issue and are investing in technology and staff to prevent future occurrences.
